answers.author: Deborah Yukolis
answers.text:
From a business attraction standpoint we have the Mesa Economic Development Action Team (MEDAT) that addresses the needs of specific projects.  MEDAT is not instituted on every project, the Directors of Economic Development Bill and Development and Sustainability need to agree on the positive impact and “special” needs of the project before the resources are deployed.  Typically a business will benefit from a customized timeline and direct interaction with department decision makers.
In addition, the Economic Development staff acts as a facilitator between the business community and the City.  If there are specific issues/questions across any topic we’ll typically run with it and get back to the business.  We engage appropriate staff from various departments/agencies when necessary.  A specific example of how the City is proactive with this concept is the Downtown Mesa coordination team which is comprised of representatives from planning, engineering, transportation, City Manager’s office, Arts & Cultural and Economic Development.  The team meets bi-weekly to discuss everything and anything Downtown related (Light Rail, Central Main Street Plan, Special Events, etc).  When issues arise, including issues with specific businesses, appropriate City staff are briefed and called upon to help resolve the issue.

answers.author: Pam Broviak
answers.text:
Our city has a staff development meeting every two weeks for the purpose of reviewing developments or issues related to developments. We have all departments in the city represented at this meeting. Many times businesses and developers are invited to these meetings to discuss their proposals. It provides a great method of keeping all departments up to date on what is going on in the city related to development, and it provides an opportunity for businesses to address or ask questions of any department.
